page.title: 09Memories of Britwell
page.content: We learnt from interviewing Mr Cooper that he moved to Britwell in 1928 and he has lived there for fifty seven years. In the first World War he fought on the somme and he can remember seeing dead men and horses around him. He was injured whilst fighting the Austrians in Italy so he was sent to hospital. When he left the hospital he remembered seeing marble pillars and steps in the entrance. After the war he was head Chauffeur to Major and Mrs Whitacker at Britwell House. Whilst they were visitng some relatives in Italy Major Whittacker said they would stop for lunch at the Hotel Merimar. As they pulled up at the hotel Mr Cooper noticed it was the same building that he stayed in when he was in hospital. After lunch he showed the Whittakers the room he had slept in.
